meanings.definition: To put (a liquid) into a bottle again.
meanings.sent1: After the party, we rebottled the leftover soda to keep it fresh.
meanings.sent2: The winery had to rebottle the wine due to a labeling error.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy waiter accidentally rebottled the same drink twice!
meanings.sent4: She rebottled her emotions, sealing them away for another day.
meanings.sent5: The process of rebottling requires precision to avoid spills.

meanings.definition: The act of putting a liquid into a bottle again.
meanings.sent1: The rebottling of the sauce was necessary to prevent spoilage.
meanings.sent2: The rebottling of the perfume was done to create smaller samples.
meanings.sent3: The rebottling of the potion made it look like a magical experiment.
meanings.sent4: The rebottling of memories can sometimes bring back forgotten scents.
meanings.sent5: The rebottling process involves cleaning and sterilizing the containers.
